title: [Large-Scale] Board Game-Based Computing Thinking and Language Integration Education Design: Strengthening Text Analysis and Expressiveness

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic programming concepts, intermediate language proficiency (writing, presentation, grammatical analysis), and understanding of board game rules
context.additional_context: Game-based classes utilizing board games to strengthen computational thinking linked to language education. Integrates language learning elements through text-based rule explanations (grammatical accuracy, lexical diversity), logical narration (use of connectives, coherence), and peer feedback exchanges (critical analysis, restructuring) during the game creation process.

learning_goals: Design and produce a board game solving real-world problems using algorithmic principles at least three times, systematically document game rules, and implement clear textual expressions through grammatical structure analysis

Share problem-solving strategies applying computational thinking elements (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithmization) with peers and strengthen explanatory skills using linguistic expression (writing, presentation, feedback)
Complete at least one project connecting programming concepts (conditionals, loops, etc.) to language learning contexts (grammatical structure analysis, vocabulary pattern mapping, text generation)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
